timeline.bodyText:
per IBM style, put variables before noun identifier
change
The ACME certificate authority at URI {0} responded that the authorization challenge failed for domain {1} with status {2}.
to
The ACME certificate authority at the  {0} URI  responded that the authorization challenge failed for the {1} domain with {2} status.
does {2} refer to the status of the failure or the domain?
timeline.author: dmuelle
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -10,19 +10,156 @@
 ###############################################################################
 # -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 #CMVCPATHNAME com.ibm.ws.security.acme/resources/com/ibm/ws/security/acme/resources/AcmeMessages.nlsprops
-#COMPONENTPREFIX CWWKX
+#COMPONENTPREFIX CWPKI
 #COMPONENTNAMEFOR WebSphere ACME
 #ISMESSAGEFILE TRUE
 #NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_VAR
 #NLS_ENCODING=UNICODE
 # -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Message prefix block: CWPKI2000 - CWPKI2299
+#-----  ACME messages
 
-# TODO: Get the correct Message Prefix block for ACME feature
-# liberty wiki should have a list of the Message Prefix
-# Message prefix block: CWWKJ0200 - CWWKJ0299
+# The ACME referred to in these messages stands for Automatic Certificate Management Environment.
+# The URI parameter in these messages is for the ACME certificate authority, such as https://sampleCAProvider.org/directory
 
-#-----  ACME messages
+# ACME CA responded that the challenge failed for domain '"	+ authorization.getIdentifier().getDomain() + "' with status " + Status.INVALID.toString()+ ".";
+CWPKI2001E=CWPKI2001E: The ACME certificate authority at URI {0} responded that the authorization challenge failed for domain {1} with status {2}.  The error is {3}.

timeline.bodyText:
this doesn't give any indication of why the challenge failed. Is that covered in the status code?
If so, the explanation should say so.

timeline.bodyText:
Verify that the URI can be successfully accessed by the calling server and the server can receive a callback
Does this mean:
Verify that the URI can be successfully accessed by the calling server and receiving a callback.
or
Verify that the URI can be successfully accessed by the calling server. Verify that the server can receive a callback.

+
